           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <mr-edit-description id="edit-description"></mr-edit-description>
        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>

 window.addEventListener('load', () => {
 window.getTSMonClient().recordIssueDetailSpaTiming();

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a></body>


      
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

    display: block;

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Nov 22, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<span class="line"><!---->In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<!----></span><br><br>The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<span class="line"><!---->The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<!----></a><br>[6]. <span class="line"><!---->[6]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<!----></a><br><br>And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <span class="line"><!---->And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <!----></span><br><br>I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<span suggestion: suggestion.diff<span class="line"><!---->Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable <span           Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mpdenton@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/749316680" title="mpdenton@chromium.org"><!---->mpdenton@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mpdenton@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mpdenton@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation>BFCache
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation&gt;BFCache
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the DCHECK here: <span class="line"><!---->It seems the DCHECK here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<!----></a><br>Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<span class="line"><!---->Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<!----></span><br><br>It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        > This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<!----></span><br>True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>>  In fact it is not the case<span class="line"><!---->&gt;  In fact it is not the case<!----></span><br>Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35"><!---->1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<!----></a><br>Author: Hajime Hoshi <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Hajime Hoshi &lt;<!----></span>hajimehoshi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/hajimehoshi@chromium.org"><!---->hajimehoshi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Nov 24 15:26:07 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Nov 24 15:26:07 2021<!----></span><br><br>Fix a possible out-of-bound access in components/page_load_metrics<span class="line"><!---->Fix a possible out-of-bound access in components/page_load_metrics<!----></span><br><br>`new_timings` is iterated at<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` is iterated at<!----></span><br>`DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore` and the index is used for<span class="line"><!---->`DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore` and the index is used for<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` at<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` at<!----></span><br>`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1272403<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1272403" title="Security: HeapOverflow in PageLoadMetrics"><!---->Bug: 1272403<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I9eae03f55b63f353f36d8372930f16034dcea7a4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I9eae03f55b63f353f36d8372930f16034dcea7a4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3299751<a On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations, Leecraso and Guang Gong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. Thank you for your efforts and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Leecraso and Guang Gong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. Thank you for your efforts and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        </div>

        Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<!----></span><br><br>This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<span class="line"><!---->This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <span class="line"><!---->Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <!----></span><br>This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <span class="line"><!---->This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <!----></span><br><br>This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        mr-issue-page {

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1272403%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D3500" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1272403%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D3500%252526ust%25253D1703408526598723%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1JCjq6Pq-q2bFTUFZoBTJs%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<span class="line"><!---->In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<!----></span><br><br>The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<span class="line"><!---->The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=925;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=925;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=925;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/observers/back_forward_cache_page_load_metrics_observer.cc;l=630;drc=3233aff82f01ca09e58cca68917979460de336fd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/observers/back_forward_cache_page_load_metrics_observer.cc;l=630;drc=3233aff82f01ca09e58cca68917979460de336fd"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/observers/back_forward_cache_page_load_metrics_observer.cc;l=630;drc=3233aff82f01ca09e58cca68917979460de336fd<!----></a><br>[5]. <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<!----></a><br>[6]. <span class="line"><!---->[6]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<!----></a><br><br>And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <span class="line"><!---->And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <!----></span><br><br>I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<span class="line"><!---->I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<!----></span><br><br>[7]. <span class="line"><!---->[7]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_metrics_util.cc;l=133;drc=5f3febba100f999ed17423e0e030d040e20c8204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_metrics_util.cc;l=133;drc=5f3febba100f999ed17423e0e030d040e20c8204"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_metrics_util.cc;l=133;drc=5f3febba100f999ed17423e0e030d040e20c8204<!----></a><br><br>Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<span class="line"><!---->Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable <!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the attached poc.diff<span class="line"><!---->Apply the attached poc.diff<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8001<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8001<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation>BFCache
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation&gt;BFCache
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the DCHECK here: <span class="line"><!---->It seems the DCHECK here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<!----></a><br>Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<span class="line"><!---->Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<!----></span><br><br>It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      <div class="issue-diff">

        > This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<!----></span><br>True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>>  In fact it is not the case<span class="line"><!---->&gt;  In fact it is not the case<!----></span><br>Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1272403<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1272403" title="Security: HeapOverflow in       </div><br>

On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35"><!---->1059bf191cc8c7a8a10fd667522b6949e8de0f35<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1272403<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1272403" title="Security: HeapOverflow in PageLoadMetrics"><!---->Bug: 1272403<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I9eae03f55b63f353f36d8372930f16034dcea7a4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I9eae03f55b63f353f36d8372930f16034dcea7a4<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:
