        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<!----></span><br><br>This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch.         Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <span class="line"><!---->Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <!----></span><br>This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <span class="line"><!---->This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <!----></span><br><br>This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Nov 22, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Nov 22, 2021)

      <option value="0" selected="">

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Nov 22, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<span class="line"><!---->In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<!----></span><br><br>The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<span class="line"><!---->The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=925;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<!----></a><br>[6]. <span class="line"><!---->[6]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<!----></a><br><br>And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <span class="line"><!---->And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <!----></span><br><br>I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<span class="line"><!---->I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<!----></span><br><br>[7]. <span class="line"><!---->[7]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_metrics_util.cc;l=133;drc=5f3febba100f999ed17423e0e030d040e20c8204<a suggestion: suggestion.diff<span class="line"><!---->Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable <!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the attached poc.diff<span class="line"><!---->Apply the attached poc.diff<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<span --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank"           Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mpdenton@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/749316680" title="mpdenton@chromium.org"><!---->mpdenton@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mpdenton@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mpdenton@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation>BFCache
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation&gt;BFCache
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the DCHECK here: <span class="line"><!---->It seems the DCHECK here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<!----></a><br>Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<span class="line"><!---->Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<!----></span><br><br>It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1272403<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1272403" title="Security: HeapOverflow in On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<!----></span><br><br>This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<span class="line"><!---->This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <span class="line"><!---->Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <!----></span><br>This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <span class="line"><!---->This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <!----></span><br><br>This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<span class="line"><!---->In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<!----></span><br><br>The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<span class="line"><!---->The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <span class="line"><!---->And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <!----></span><br><br>I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<span suggestion: suggestion.diff<span class="line"><!---->Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable <!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the attached poc.diff<span class="line"><!---->Apply the attached poc.diff<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8001<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8001<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 6:08 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation>BFCache
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation&gt;BFCache
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the DCHECK here: <span class="line"><!---->It seems the DCHECK here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<!----></a><br>Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<span class="line"><!---->Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<!----></span><br><br>It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Medium Security_Severity-High
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Medium Security_Severity-High
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        > This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<!----></span><br>True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>>  In fact it is not the case<span class="line"><!---->&gt;  In fact it is not the case<!----></span><br>Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1272403#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      altimin@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3985044989" title="altimin@google.com"><!---->altimin@google.com<!----></a>

On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span class="line"><!---->This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<!----></span><br>`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<span class="line"><!---->`back_forward_cache_restores_` by adding boundary checks.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1272403<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1272403" title="Security: HeapOverflow in PageLoadMetrics"><!---->Bug: 1272403<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I9eae03f55b63f353f36d8372930f16034dcea7a4<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`.  On the other hand,<!----></span><br>`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` can be updated via mojo message<!----></span><br>`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadMetrics.UpdateTiming`, then in theory it is possible to make<!----></span><br>`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`. This could<!----></span><br>cause an out-of-bound access.<span class="line"><!---->cause an out-of-bound access.<!----></span><br><br>This change fixes this out-of-bound access to<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<!----></span><br><br>This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<span class="line"><!---->This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <span class="line"><!---->Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <!----></span><br>This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <span class="line"><!---->This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <!----></span><br><br>This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<span class="line"><!---->In function |DispatchEventsAfterBackForwardCacheRestore|[1], when visiting |new_timings|, |i| will be passed into |OnFirstInputAfterBackForwardCacheRestoreInPage|[2], and finally as the index to access |back_forward_cache_restores_|[3] and |back_forward_cache_navigation_ids_|[4].<!----></span><br><br>The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<span class="line"><!---->The |new_timings| could be updated through the mojo IPC Call |UpdateTiming|[5], so we can trigger the out-of-bounds by constructing the size of the array |back_forward_cache_timings|[6].<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=136;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;l=167;drc=4ad3249a94f386ee2d5c8509cea424e5538bb173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->[5]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=392;drc=e0bcd799231fef912ab8d1fa938aab46c022b273<!----></a><br>[6]. <span class="line"><!---->[6]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/common/page_load_metrics.mojom;l=163;drc=739200ab4a3bb86eefcc1aa6d74fd65530618f56<!----></a><br><br>And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <span class="line"><!---->And because it will compare the contents of the out-of-bounds access with the controllable input[7], the attacker can leak memory data through the difference of the code execution time in different branches. <!----></span><br><br>I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<span class="line"><!---->I also attached the exploit code demo in the following files, it could leak 8 bytes of data in 10+s without any user gesture.<!----></span><br><br>[7]. <span suggestion: suggestion.diff<span class="line"><!---->Fix suggestion: suggestion.diff<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable <span           Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation>BFCache
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          hajimehoshi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium FoundIn-96 OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros Pri-2
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation&gt;BFCache
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the DCHECK here: <span class="line"><!---->It seems the DCHECK here: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/page_load_metrics/browser/page_load_tracker.cc;drc=de68be3f18ba99cc01d75903e167ca09bade253c;l=134<!----></a><br>Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<span class="line"><!---->Probably should not be a DCHECK but instead should be something like mojo::ReportBadMessage().<!----></span><br><br>It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like this is only triggerable from a compromised renderer and provides a noisy "less than" primitive on an out-of-bounds read. I think attempting an information leak here would be very difficult given that it relies on measuring execution timing (for a non-synchronous mojo message) and it requires some very very precise massaging of the heap (and probably the ability to allocate copies of the secret data over and over). So I'll mark this as Severity_Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        > This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This dcheck is irrelevant to the vulnerability, it even could ensure that the size of new_timings become larger.<!----></span><br>True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->True though this should still be a mojo::ReportBadMessage(). Your proposed patch works but I wonder if there's a less error-prone way to mojo::ReportBadMessage() as soon as possible in case small code-path changes reopen this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br>>  In fact it is not the case<span class="line"><!---->&gt;  In fact it is not the case<!----></span><br>Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you! Yes I misinterpreted how |i| was being used. 70% in 10s is quite high and could presumably be improved. I'll bump this to High Severity as it amounts to an OOB read in the browser process and we'll want to make sure merges are applied as quickly as possible.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

On the other hand,<span class="line"><!---->`PageLoadTracker::GetBackForwardCacheRestore`. This could<span class="line"><!---->`new_timings` larger than `back_forward_cache_restores_`.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the reward! But there is a little question that confuses me:<!----></span><br><br>This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<span class="line"><!---->This is a report of a vulnerability that can be exploited without any user interaction, with exploit codes and an accepted patch. I'm kind of confused why the bounty is lower than those hard-to-exploit vulnerabilities which may require lots of specific user interaction or almost impossible race competition.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <span class="line"><!---->Hi leecraso@, thanks for the question. <!----></span><br>This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <span class="line"><!---->This was actually rewarded higher than the "hard-to-exploit" vulnerabilities that require user interaction, tight race conditions, and/or malicious extension installation, which have been rewarded at $7000-$10,000 on average. <!----></span><br><br>This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue, while in the browser process, is an OOB access resulting in an 8-byte data leak, so it was also judged as a user information disclosure with a bonus for report quality and exploit than a full memory corruption in a full memory corruption in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.         mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
